result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavell A. Wester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lavell A. Wester is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lavell A. Wester was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
May not have contact with Amanda Anderson, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

timeConds.notes:
Huber & Work Crew is authorized.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.    
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given (Unless previously provided).   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
  May not have contact with Amanda A or Beatrice O or reside with women without consent of agent, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.
**ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE COLLECTED**

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Extended Supervision,.
18 months WSP; 1 yr Initial followed by 6 mo ES.  Not eligible for CIP or SAP

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Cassi Baumgardner.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.     Defendant is sentenced to 18 months in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervision.  Credit for 117 days to be applied to prison sentence.   No contact with Amanda A. or Beatrice Oates.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights given.
SEHR rescheduled to 9/9/16 at 11:30 AM as DE is currently in the Racine Co. Jail and no writ was prepared by the DA's Office.
Atty Cassi Baumgardner

Prior: 4111 50th Street  #1, Kenosha, WI 53144
SEHR date requested by Agent Barbara Korth @ DOC
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Lavell A. Wester, appeared with Attorney Lauren Jane Breckenfelder.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 45 days in the KCJ commencing on 3/26/16 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew is authorized.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Amanda A. unless permitted by the court only.  Appeal Rights given.

9:55 a.m. - Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (late) with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Signature bond reinstated; authorization for bench warrant is vacated.  At the request of Atty Breckenfelder, FPT adj. to 3/10/16 at 9:10.  Bond continued.

9:21 a.m. - Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Lauren Breckenfelder appeared for def.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. did not appear.  Case was scheduled for 9:00 a.m.  Signature bond ordered forfeited.  Bench warrant to issue with a $3,000.00 cash bond.
Atty Lauren Breckenfelder
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk

940.19(1) -Battery, DV, Repeater   947.01(1) -DC/DV, Repeater

235 p.m.   Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.    Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clk  Janell Thwing.   Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel. Not Guilty Plea.    Deft demands jury trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 09:00 am. $2500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
